page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area lies between the South Downs and Queen Elizabeth Country Park to the south and Petersfield to the north {Ecology:}Primarily a farming region, the countryside contains large numbers of small woods and copses of mainly deciduous trees. A network of footpaths cover the area. {Transport:}The A3 London to Portsmouth road crosses the area from the cutting in Butser Hill north-east towards Petersfield. The London to Portsmouth railway line also crosses the area. {Population:}The main areas of population are the southern outskirts of Petersfield and the ancient village of Buriton, which is a conservation area. {Landscape:}The Petersfield Heath with its surrounding land and Buriton are popular beauty spots.
